riddle: Neural networks are inspired by which human body part?
I am the brain's invisible friend, holding memories in ordered rows. Delete me and chaos unfolds. What am I?
Born from trees, I become a memory. Pages turn but I never forget. In ancient halls I store the world's wisdom. What am I?
I guard the gates with questions three. Right answers pass, wrong ones flee. I stand between you and your data. What am I?
A circle's home where heads and tails both meet. Remove one end, join it back, and still I'm complete. What am I?
Last in, first out, I grow from the bottom. Push me down, pop me up. A tower of data. What am I?
I branch like a tree but have no leaves. My roots spread data, my nodes hold keys. Search me wisely. What am I?
One becomes two, two becomes many. I repeat myself endlessly, calling my own name. Beware the infinite fall. What am I?
I connect the disconnected, bridging worlds apart. Click a path and I'll transport you through hyperspace. What am I?
I speak in zeros and ones, the language of gods. Humans fear my tongue but machines obey. What am I?
Born from chaos, I bring order through comparison. I rearrange the scattered into perfect harmony. What am I?
A invisible thread connecting parent to child. Break me and the family tree crumbles. What am I?
I am a question that returns an answer. Feed me input, I give you output. Many call my name in code. What am I?
Neither true nor false, I exist in emptiness. I am nothing, yet programmers fear me most. What am I?
I convert the human tongue to machine language, translating dreams into reality, one line at a time. What am I?
I’m the brain within your computer. What am I?
Tiny yet powerful, I can be positive or negative. What am I?
I am the universe's library, holding vast knowledge. What am I?
I sort by swapping neighbors. What am I?
I let teams edit code together. What am I?
I’m a guardian of secrets, turning info unreadable. What am I?
I care about spaces more than braces. Who am I?
I’m the keyword to define a class. What am I?
I uniquely identify a row in a table. What am I?
I’m a tree where every level is fully filled left to right. What am I?
I repeat code without copying it. What am I?
I’m the fastest sort, but need sorted input. What am I?
I store key-value pairs for quick lookup. What am I?
I’m the memory where variables live temporarily. What am I?
I’m the language of the web, run in browsers. What am I?
I’m the fastest way to find duplicates. Who am I?
I’m a collection that grows dynamically. What am I?
I power the internet, connecting machines worldwide. What am I?
I’m the blueprint for objects. What am I?
I optimize queries in databases. What am I?
I am a programming language that is easy to learn. I use indentation for blocks. I am named after a creature in wildlife. What am I?
hint: I start with 'P' and am very beginner-friendly.

riddle: I repeat code multiple times. I can count from 1 to 10. Users can control how many times I run. What am I?
hint: I help avoid writing the same code over and over.

riddle: I am a process where systems learn patterns from examples and improve without being explicitly programmed. What am I?
I help computers understand images and videos, detecting objects and faces. What am I?
hint: It's about seeing and understanding visuals.

riddle: I am inspired by how the human brain works and consist of connected units. What am I?
I use many layers to learn complex patterns from data. What am I?
I help machines understand human language and power chatbots and translators. What am I?
I convert words into numbers while preserving meaning. What am I?
I assign items into predefined categories like spam or not spam. What am I?
I group similar items together without labels. What am I?
I make machines act smart and intelligent. What am I?
I predict numerical values like price or temperature. What am I?
I make decisions using yes/no questions and look like an upside-down tree. What am I?
I measure how many predictions are correct out of all predictions. What am I?
I describe data like images, audio, and videos that don’t fit into tables. What am I?
Learning with labeled data is called what?
AI that talks like humans and answers questions is called what?
A neural network that learns from past or sequential data is called what?
Neural networks are inspired by which human body part?
